sen.j: 伊賀 兼光（いが かねみつ、生没年不詳）は、鎌倉時代末期から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての御家人、実務官僚。
sen.e: Kanemitsu IGA (years of birth and death are unknown) was a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) and governmental official responsible for practical works in the late Kamakura period through the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 六波羅探題越訴頭人であった山城国国司伊賀光政の子。
sen.e: The son of Mitsumasa IGA, Yamashiro no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Yamashiro Province), who was the Ossotonin (the head of legal institutions of Kamakura bakufu and Muromachi bakufu) in the Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto).

sen.j: 父の官名にちなみ山城兼光とも。
sen.e: Kanemitsu is also referred to as Kanemitsu YAMASHIRO after his father's name of a government office.

sen.j: 伊賀氏は、藤原北家藤原秀郷流と伝えられる。
sen.e: The Iga clan is said to be the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Hidesato house.
The Iga clan is said to be the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, the line of FUJIWARA no Hidesato.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代初期の、伊賀国守伊賀朝光以降、伊賀を名字としたとされている。
sen.e: It is said that the clan began to use the family name Iga since IGA no Tomomitsu who was the Iga no kuni no Kami (officer in charge of regional administration in Iga) in the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 以後、北条氏の外戚として鎌倉幕府の有力御家人であったが伊賀氏の変以後勢力を弱め、評定衆、引付衆など幕府の実務官僚として活躍した家系である。
sen.e: Although the clan had been senior vassals of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as maternal relatives of the Hojo clan, they lost their power due to the Incident of the Iga clan, and then they worked as governmental officials responsible for practical works such as Hyojoshu (a member of Council of State) and Hikitsukeshu (Coadjutor of the High Court).

sen.j: 兼光も、鎌倉時代末期には六波羅探題の引付頭人兼評定衆となっている。
sen.e: Kanemitsu himself became Hikitsuke tonin (chairman of the court of justice) and Hyojoshu at the Rokuhara Tandai in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: この頃の所領は不明であるが、歴史学者の網野善彦は、文永2年（1265年）11月に兼光の曾祖父伊賀光宗の跡（後継者）として、若狭国耳西郷・日向浦の地頭職を継承したことが確認されている伊勢前司、及び、元亨4年（1324年）3月の日付がある大和国般若寺の文殊菩薩像墨書銘に見える施主前伊勢守藤原兼光を、伊賀兼光と推定している。
sen.e: Although the shoryo (territory) of the Iga clan at this time is unknown, historian Yoshihiko AMINO assumes that the former official of Ise Province who took over the position of Jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor) of the Jisei-kyo Village and Hyugaura in Wakasa Province as the heir of Mitsumune IGA, great grandfather of Kanamitsu, in November 1265, and FUJIWARA no Kanemitsu, donor and former Ise no kami (Governor of Ise Province) who appears on Monjubosatsuzo bokushomei (statue of Manjusri (bodhisattva), ink inscriptions) of the Hannya-ji Temple of Yamato province dated in March 1324, are Kanamitsu IGA.
sen.cmt: 「施主前伊勢守」を donor and former Ise no kami (Governor of Ise Province)と訳しました。
sen.e: Although his shoryo (territory) at this time is unknown, a historian Yoshihiko AMINO assumes that FUJIWARA no Kanemitsu as follows was Kanemitsu IGA; the former Governor of Ise Province who took over the position of Jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor) of the Jisei-kyo Village and Hyugaura in Wakasa Province in December 1265 as the heir of Mitsumune IGA, great grandfather of Kanemitsu, and a donor and former Ise no kami (Governor of Ise Province) who appears on Monju Bosatsuzo Bokushomei (statue of Manjusri [bodhisattva], ink inscriptions) of the Hannya-ji Temple in Yamato Province dated in April 1324.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、原文に合わせました。

sen.j: この説では、文殊菩薩像墨書銘に願主として殊音（文観）が見えること、「金輪聖主御願成就」とあるのは後醍醐天皇による正中の変の成功を指しているとして、兼光を建武の新政以前から後醍醐天皇に内通していたと見ている。
sen.e: According to this theory, Kanemitsu had naitsu (engage in secret communication) with the Emperor Godaigo before the Kemmu Restoration because Shuon (Monkan) can be seen on the Monjubosatsuzo bokushomei and 'Konrinshoshu migonjoju' (realization of an ambition of being Gold Wheel holy lord) is thought to suggest the success of the Shochu Disturbance which was raised by the Emperor Godaigo.

According to this theory, Kanemitsu had engaged in secret communication with the Emperor Godaigo before the Kenmu Restoration because Shuon (a priest, also known as Monkan) is listed in the Monju Bosatsuzo Bokushomei as a petitioner, and 'Konrinshoshu migonjoju' (realization of an ambition of being Gold Wheel holy lord) is thought to suggest the success of the Shochu Disturbance which was raised by the Emperor Godaigo.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「願主として」を補足しました。ほか表現を変えました。
sen.e: According to this theory, Kanemitsu had engaged in secret communication with the Emperor Godaigo before the Kenmu Restoration because Shuon (a priest, also known as Monkan) is listed in the Monju Bosatsuzo Bokushomei as a petitioner, and 'Konrinshoshu migonjoju' (realization of an ambition of being Gold Wheel holy lord) is thought to suggest the success of the Shochu Disturbance which was raised by the Emperor Godaigo.

sen.j: 更に後醍醐天皇と楠木正成とを仲介したとする見解もある。
sen.e: Further, there is a theory that Kanemitsu mediated between the Emperor Godaigo and Masashige KUSUNOKI.

sen.j: 建武の新政が始まると、若狭守護と国司を兼任し、更に図書頭兼土佐守、大蔵少輔に任ぜられる。
sen.e: When the Kemmu Restoration started, Kanemitsu concurrently served as Shugo (Military Governor) of Wakasa Province and kokushi (provincial governors), as well as Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) and Tosa no kuni no kami (the governor of Tosa Province), and also the Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury) under the Okurasho ritsuryo sei (the political system based on the codes of the Ministry of Finance).

When the Kenmu Restoration started, Kanemitsu concurrently served as Shugo (Military Governor) and kokushi (provincial governors) of Wakasa Province, and Zusho no kami (Director of the Bureau of Drawings and Books), Tosa no kami (Governor of Tosa Province), and Okura no shofu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury) as additional posts.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「図書寮兼土佐国守、大蔵省律令制における大蔵省」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「図書頭兼土佐守、大蔵少輔」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。

sen.j: 一方で雑訴決断所（五畿内担当）、窪所、記録所、恩賞方を兼任し、新政の役職の中枢を占める幹部として活躍した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, he concurrently served as Zasso-Ketsudansho (agency of Kenmu government to file lawsuits) (in charge of Gokinai capital region), monchujo (a court of justice), Kubodokoro (a court of justice) during the Kemmu Restoration period, Kirokujo (land record office) and Onshogata (the Reward Office which is the administrative organ of the Kenmu Regime, responsible for granting military awards called 'onsho'), and played an important role as the top official of the Restoration.

sen.e: However, the Restoration collapsed in two and half years, and the whereabouts of Kanamitsu afterward is unknown.
